etymology.description: A tree (木) with its top highlighted by an extra stroke, indicating the apex; contrast 本, 朱.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a tree with an added line at the crown to single out the very top. By marking the furthest point upward, it extends to meanings like tip, end, or extremity.

examples.chinese: 期末考试就要到了，请好好复习(期末考試就要到了，請好好複習)。
examples.pinyin: Qīmò kǎoshì jiù yào dàole, qǐng hǎohǎo fùxí.
examples.english: The end-of-term exam is coming; please study well.

examples.chinese: 他在绳子的末端打了个结(他在繩子的末端打了個結)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài shéngzi de mòduān dǎle gè jié.
examples.english: He tied a knot at the end of the rope.

examples.chinese: 年末公司会发奖金(年末公司會發獎金)。
examples.english: At the end of the year, the company gives out bonuses.
